reviews.text:
Pork lard is very fresh. Soup is very flavourful. I drank till the last drop. Pork slices are marinated and not overly salty.

Sauce on rice with pork lard is matched make in heaven.

Boss is very friendly.

This Ipoh pork noodles is awesome with such generous amount of ingredients for $5. The ingredients include slices of liver, minced meat, sliced pork, pork balls and vegetables. They also added Áå™Ê≤πÊ∏£for added fragrance but no everyone enjoys this stuff.  I can say you don‚Äôt get this amount of ingredients from any minced pork noodles stall. There‚Äôs a dry version at $5.50, if you prefer.

Been patronising this stall for quite some time; visited on a Friday evening and the queue was very manageable.

Extremely al dente noodles - springy and delectable. Char siew on the thicker side with some fats.

An AFI would be to cook the pork lards bits in-house, rather than using the readymade ones.

My first time here and tried their wanton noodle.
Noodle was perfectly cooked, has the Q Q feel üòä
In my opinion , this coffeeshop can only depend on them to bring in crowds. Hopefully they find a better location and I‚Äôm very sure they will do very well.

All the 9 dishes offered here are unique in taste and flavor. Hard to find elsewhere in Singapore. Attribute the excellent taste to the chef‚Äôs personal concoction. Must eat here often. Now this is my 2nd time having this Mala wanton noodle.
